newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Island Dyeing says in share sale talks.
newsitem.headline: Island Dyeing says in share sale talks.

text.p: Island Dyeing and Printing Co Ltd said on Monday its main shareholders Itochu Corp, Itochu Hong Kong Ltd and Daido-Maruta Finishing Co Ltd were in preliminary discussions for sale of a total 45 percent of the company to an independent third party.
Island Dyeing's director Yoshinori Izeki said it was anticipated that the 29.70 million shares would be sold at a price of less than HK$8.45 per share but no binding agreement had yet been entered.
Its shares were last traded at HK$8.45 per share on Friday before trading was suspended. The shares were up HK$0.35 at HK$8.80 after resuming trade on Monday.
Izeki said it was anticipated that a general offer in respect of the remaining shares would be made if the share sale took place. The statement gave no further details.
Itochu Corp, Itochu Hong Kong and a wholly-owned unit of First Pacific Co Ltd held 27.48, 11.78 and 13.75 percent respectively of Island Dyeing as at October 1995.
